posts.content:
Original build can be found here: http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 33821.html
 
This is my version, adapted to use in a vanilla environment where enemy PCs have access to the most powerful equipment, with all possible toolset item properties. They can be equally godly and immune to everything except this archer’s arrows that are infused with divine damage.

Differences to the original build:
 
1. Bard 1 vs Bard 2 pre-epic:
One has to choose between additional 4 HP or 2 skill points. No difference in base saves. Bard spells are almost useless in an environment teeming with gods.
 
2. Feat selection:
Extra Turning and Rapid Shot are excluded from selection because one can get it from items. Improved Critical is not important if one expects opponents to be immune to critical hits.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Darktooth. Just a couple of things to bear in mind for others wanting to play this build.

The build attracts a 20% xp penalty from level 4 until level 40. This may not be important in PWs, but could well be in module play. It's also, technically, an illegal build - alignment constraints - which may make it unplayable in certain PWs and modules.

Just for compare and contrast purposes, have you seen Mick Dagger's Holy Elven Archer? It uses Wizard rather than Bard, but otherwise is similar.

Cheers
